SEARCH
Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree

Class EventTreeBuilder<E extends Event>

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree.EventTreeBuilder<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of event in the tree to be built
public class EventTreeBuilder<E extends Event> extends Object
A factory object used to build an event tree from a set of events. This class can be extended to modify how event trees are built or to add new types of branches.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Field Details

    • events

      protected final Map<E extends Event,Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>>> events
      Maps the events this tree (and its branches) will contain to their preconditions. Note a precondition in this map may not match the key event's precondition if this builder is being used to construct a branch where some expressions have been previously tested.

    • build

      public EventTree<E> build(Worker.Status status)
      Constructs the event tree and all its branches. For large sets of events this method may take a long time to run. If the set of events for this builder is empty, this method will return the empty tree.
      Parameters:
      status - the status object to be updated as the tree is built
      Returns:
      the event tree

    • build

      protected EventTree<E> build(EventTreeStatus status)
      Constructs the event tree and all its branches. If the set of events for this builder is empty, this method returns null, meaning this method should be used for building all branches except the root (use build(Status) to build the root, since it will return the empty tree if the builder has no events).

      If the preconditions of all events in this tree are either false or true, this method will build a leaf node containing all events whose preconditions are true. Otherwise, this method will choose an expression on which to branch and create the appropriate event tree type and all of its branches for that expression.

      This method should increment the total number of branches as soon as it starts running and increment the number of completed branches right before it returns.

      Parameters:
      status - the status object tracking how many branches have been started and completed
      Returns:
      the event tree

    • chooseExpression

      protected Expression chooseExpression(EventTreeStatus status)
      Chooses an expression on which to branch. An ideal expression is one which splits the events in this tree into a large number of groups of about equal size.
      Parameters:
      status - the status object
      Returns:
      the expression on which to branch

    • buildBooleanEventTree

      protected EventTree<E> buildBooleanEventTree(Expression expression, EventTreeStatus status)
      Builds a tree which branches based an expression of type boolean.
      Parameters:
      expression - an expression of type boolean
      status - the status object
      Returns:
      an event tree which branches on the expression

    • getSatisfiedEvents

      protected ImmutableSet<E> getSatisfiedEvents()
      Returns all events in this builder whose preconditions are true as a set.
      Returns:
      a set of events whose preconditions are satisfied

    • getRelevantEvents

      protected LinkedHashMap<E,Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>>> getRelevantEvents(Expression expression, Value value)
      Returns a new map of events from this builder which has preconditions that contain the given expression. The preconditions the events are mapped to will have the expression replaced with the given value.
      Parameters:
      expression - the expression which needs to appear in an event's precondition
      value - the value to replace that expression with
      Returns:
      a map of relevant events with their updated preconditions

    • getIrrelevantEvents

      protected LinkedHashMap<E,Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>>> getIrrelevantEvents(Expression expression)
      Returns a new map of events from this builder whose preconditions do not contain the given expressions. The preconditions the events are mapped to will be the same as their are in this builder. This method is generally used to build the irrelevant branch.
      Parameters:
      expression - the expression which does not appear in an event's precondition
      Returns:
      a map of events for which this expression is irrelevant with the same preconditions they currently have
